author: Special Correspondent
text:
Alagappa University College of Physical Education (AUCPE) won football and cricket championships in the 23rd State-level Inter-Collegiate Football and Cricket Tournaments held at Umayal Stadium here from February 12 to 14, an university release said.

Football teams from 13 colleges and cricket teams from 14 colleges from various parts of the State took part in the tournaments, organised by Alumni Association of the AUCPE and inaugurated by Registrar (in-charge) V. Balachandran.

The AUCPE won the football tournament by beating St. Joseph College, Tiruchi, and the cricket tournament by beating Mannar Thirumalai Naicker Arts College, Madurai.

The Alumni Association had been conducting the football tournament for the past 23 years and the cricket tournament for the past eight years, the release said.

Vice-Chancellor of Alagappa University S. Subbiah presided over the valedictory function here on Sunday, and distributed trophies, certificates and prizes to the winners.

Addressing the function, he said that the first three Vice-Chancellors of Tamil Nadu Physical Education and Sports University were alumni of the AUCPE and the Department of Physical Education. They also taught at their alma mater before becoming Vice-Chancellors, he said.

He exhorted the students to emulate these eminent men and involve themselves in various sports events. They should achieve fame in their chosen sports and games and bring laurels to their institution and nation, he said.

Athichan Pillai, former Principal of the AUCPE, S. Sivaramakrishnan, former Professor, offered felicitations.
title: AUCPE wins football, cricket championships
